conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric render with extruded walls, visible thickness, and interior volume; ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and multi-face wall geometry; good angled view and clean cutaway. Minor simplifications in some wall/edge detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (living/dining connected to kitchen; bedroom and toilet to the right). However, balcony treatment appears inconsistent: 3D shows a prominent corner balcony and also a long glass-railed exterior strip by the bedroom, while the 2D plan indicates a single balcony at the bottom-left. Some openings/window placements appear approximate rather than exact.

interior_elements.notes: Living, dining, kitchen cabinetry/appliances, and bedroom bed are present and plausibly placed. Bathroom shows fixtures (sink/tub), but the WC/shower configuration does not clearly match the 2D toilet layout.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with distinct walls/floors/openings and good lighting. Presentation is clean with minimal artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/exterior edge condition does not faithfully match the 2D plan: 3D suggests an additional/relocated balcony-like strip along the bedroom side and a different balcony emphasis than the single bottom-left balcony in 2D.
Window/opening placements and sizes appear approximated; not all openings align confidently with the 2D plan locations.
Bathroom fixture set/layout appears simplified and may not include/represent the toilet fixture as shown in the 2D plan.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway conversion with strong spatial readability, but with noticeable layout fidelity issues around the balcony/exterior edges and some opening/fixture mismatches.
